div.l: That haden̄ ydwellyd in the hall of which I sey
Testyf they were and lusty for to pley
And onely for hir merth and reuelrye
Vp on̄ the wardein besily they krye
To yeue hem leue but a litle stound
To go to þe myll and se her corn̄ yground
And hardely they durst ley her nek
The Miller͗e shold nat stele hem half a pek
Of corn̄ by sleight / ne by force hem reve
And atte last the wardein yave hem leve
Iohn hight that one / and Alleyn hight þᵗat other
Of oo toun̄ were þey born̄ þᵗat hight Strother
Fer͗e in the North I can̄ nat tell where
This Aleyn̄ maketh redy all his gere
And on̄ an hors þe sak he kist anoon̄
Forth goth Aleyn̄ þe Clerk / and also Iohn
Wᵗith gode swerd and bokeler by hir side
Iohn knewe þe wey hem nedeth no gide
And at the last / the sak doun̄ he layth
Alleyn̄ spake first / all haile Symond in faith
How fares thy fair͗e doughter and thy wyf
Aleyn̄ welcom̄ koth Symkyn̄ by my lyf
And Iohn also / how now what do ye here
By god koth Iohn / nede most ne hath no pere
Hym byhoues to s̉erue hym self / þat has no swayn̄
Orels he is a fole / as Clerkes sayn̄
Our Maunciple I hope he woll be dede
Swa werkes eủere the wanges in his hede
And for thy ys I com̄ and eke Aleyn̄
To grynd our͗e corn̄ an cary mele ageyn̄
I pray yoᵘ spede vs hen̄ / what þᵗat ye may
Yt shall be don̄ koth Symkyn̄ by my fay
What woll ye do while it is in hand
By god / right by the hoper woll I stand
Koth Iohn and se how the corn̄ gaas In
Yitte saugh I neủere by my fader kyn̄
How þᵗat the hoper wagges tyll and fra
Aleyn̄ answerd · Iohn wyll þᵘou swa
Than woll I be beneth / by my croun̄
And see how þᵗat þe mele falles doun̄
In tyll þe trough þat shall be my disport
